The project aims to enhance food security, water conservation, and sustainability in the region by offering high-quality, safe, and pesticide-free fruits and vegetables through innovative farming practices.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes a sustainable food production project that aims to enhance food security and sustainability through innovative agricultural practices.
business_innovation: TRUE. The collaboration between Nadec and Pure Harvest Smart Farms to implement high-tech, climate-controlled food production systems represents a business innovation in the agriculture sector.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the production of sustainable, locally grown fresh fruits and vegetables that are free of pesticides and aim to reduce negative environmental impacts throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights the use of high-tech, climate-controlled systems and innovative farming practices to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability in food production.
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit characteristics of greenwashing; it focuses on genuine efforts towards sustainable food production and environmental benefits.

title: Dairy Robotics: Building tech for the new generation of farmers - SiliconRepublic.com
summary: Dairy Robotics is focused on modernizing the dairy industry through the use of advanced AI technologies, such as animal health monitoring devices and robotic milking systems, to improve efficiency, productivity, and sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation as Dairy Robotics is introducing cutting-edge technology to improve animal health monitoring and automate milking processes in the dairy industry, which can contribute to reducing emissions and promoting sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. This is a business innovation as Dairy Robotics is bringing new products and processes to market that significantly differ from traditional dairy farming methods, with a focus on advanced technologies to enhance productivity.
green_product: TRUE. The animal health monitoring devices and robotic milking systems developed by Dairy Robotics are designed to significantly reduce environmental impact by improving efficiency, reducing energy consumption, and promoting sustainability in the dairy industry.
green_process: TRUE. Dairy Robotics' approach involves implementing advanced AI technologies to automate processes in the dairy industry, which aims to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, and enhance sustainability.
product_or_process: Product: Animal health monitoring devices and robotic milking systems
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit characteristics of greenwashing; it showcases genuine efforts to introduce environmentally beneficial technologies in the dairy industry.

title: Okinawa Autotech to invest ₹220 cr in three years to develop new powertrain, products - BusinessLine
summary: Okinawa Autotech plans to invest €25 million in developing new products and powertrains, establish a global R&D center in Italy, and launch an electric cruiser motorcycle in India.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as it involves investing in new environmentally friendly technologies and products.
business_innovation: TRUE. The company is investing in new product development and powertrains, which qualifies as business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The article mentions the development of an electric cruiser motorcycle that aligns with the concept of a green product, focusing on reducing environmental impact and utilizing EV technology.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not provide detailed information on specific manufacturing or operational processes to assess if they align with green process definitions.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 336999 - All Other Transportation Equipment Manufacturing, 541710 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences, 336112 - Light Truck and Utility Vehicle Manufacturing, 336991 - Motorcycle, Bicycle, and Parts Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. There is no indication of misleading environmental claims in the article.
